Title: Software Engineer I - Digital Product Development
Job_Description:
Description

At Corteva Agriscience, you will help us grow what’s next. You will be part of a team that is building the future of sustainable agriculture – leading breakthroughs in the innovation and application of science and technology that will better the lives of people all over the world and fuel the progress of humankind.
The Product Development team is a part of the Farming Solutions & Digital group that designs and builds customer-facing digital solutions that maximize value for farmers and advisors. Our work helps fuel and expose Corteva’s scientific innovation.
The Core Data Team, on which you will be a Software Engineer, is in the unique position of being both a full-stack team and owning the data that lies at the heart of all of our ag-related digital products. As such, our customers are both external users and internal teams. This provides us the opportunity to dig into the deep technical details of being foundational to all of our digital products while also learning the breadth of the ag domain. Your responsibilities will include:

The Software Engineer builds and tends to the team’s backend services, front-end experiences, and AWS infrastructure. In this position, you would provide contributions to tooling used by Corteva’s agronomists and seed sales representatives to plan and manage seed and product placement experiments that take place throughout crop growing seasons. Candidates should be familiar with building and maintaining web applications using React, relational and key/value-based databases, and demonstrable experience tying the pieces together using a mix of strictly and loosely typed programming languages.

Title: Software Engineer I - Digital Product Development
Job_Description:
Description

At Corteva Agriscience, you will help us grow what’s next. No matter your role, you will be part of a team that is building the future of agriculture – leading breakthroughs in the innovation and application of science and technology that will better the lives of people all over the world and fuel the progress of humankind.
The Product Development team is a part of the Farming Solutions & Digital group that designs and builds customer-facing digital solutions that maximize value for farmers and advisors. Our work helps fuel and expose Corteva’s scientific innovation.
The Staff Cloud Engineer owns our cloud infrastructure, CI/CD patterns and tooling, and SRE practices. Your responsibilities on the CE team will be to help accelerate the rest of our engineering organization; by providing domain expertise, designing opinionated CI/CD patterns, and helping drive the adoption of our patterns across the business. Candidates should be familiar with AWS cloud architecture, Terraform, Gitlab CI/CD patterns, serverless architecture, Kubernetes, Docker and Docker Compose, and Python.

Title: Software Engineer I - Digital Product Development
Job_Description:
Description

Corteva Agriscience LLC seeks a FT Sr. Software Engineer in Johnston, IA. The Sr. Software Engineer will be responsible for building and enhancing precision Ag solutions for use by prod. dev. teams, farmers and those who support them using critical skills and knowledge in chem. engineering.
Qualifications

This position requires a Bachelor’s degree or equiv. in in Chem. Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Info. Systems, or a related field and five yrs. of related exp. Must also have 12 months of exp. (which may have been gained concurrently) with each of the following: (1) Modifying existing software to correct errors and to improve its performance; proactively involved in fixing defects after release; (2) Designing, developing, and modifying software systems, using scientific analysis, chem. engineering knowledge, and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design; (3) Exp. with infrastructure as code, automation, monitoring, and the DevOps mindset; and troubleshooting complex code issues; (4) Exp. building and supporting APIs and responsible for building code in different environments; and (5) Utilizing the following tools/technologies: Python, C#, ASP.NET, LINQ, PostgreSQL, React, AWS Lambda, Kubernetes, Amazon ECS, JavaScript, JQuery, TypeScript, Knockout JS, Angular, CSS, Bootstrap, Angular Material, MVC, MVVM, and various versioning tools. Please apply online at https://careers.corteva.com/en-us/.

Title: Technical Program Manager - Digital Product Development
Job_Description:
Description

At Corteva Agriscience, you will help us grow what’s next. No matter your role, you will be part of a team that is building the future of sustainable agriculture – leading breakthroughs in the innovation and application of science and technology that will better the lives of people all over the world and fuel the progress of humankind.
The Product Development team is a part of the Farming Solutions & Digital group that designs and builds customer-facing digital solutions that maximize value for farmers and advisors. Our work helps fuel and expose Corteva’s scientific innovation.
The Technical Program Manager partners with functional and multi-functional leaders to drive the planning and execution of sophisticated technical programs. As a Technical Program Manager, you will support and mentor teams toward high performance by empowering them to utilize Agile methods, enabling quality delivery while maintaining a focus on continuous improvement. This role will optimize team efficiency by removing impediments that may obstruct the pursuit of the team's goals and by preserving flexibility and ability to rapidly respond to changes. You will work in tandem with all stakeholders (including but not limited to Engineering, Product Management, User Experience etc.) in driving the execution of cross-functional technical programs.

Title: Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Description

Corteva Agriscience has an exciting opportunity for a Process Development Chemist located in Indianapolis, IN. The position is focused on the discovery and development of organic synthesis technology for the cost-effective manufacture of novel agricultural crop protection products. The position exists to support a growing pipeline of experimental products under development by the Corteva Agriscience business.
Primary Responsibilities (How you will grow and what you will do):
Conceive and develop novel synthetic routes to target product molecules.
Define, design, and develop the AI manufacturing processes, which should be cost-effective, safe and sustainable.

Title: Data Scientist, Breeder Analyst (MS/PHD)
Job_Description:
Description

Who are we, and what do we do?
Are you better at statistics than most programmers and better at programming than most statisticians? Do you show the world your best scientific ideas with software demos in place of PowerPoint presentations? Do you feel equally excited about working at a corn field and working at a command line? If you answered yes to these questions, read on – you might be a good fit for our Data Scientist position.
We are looking for a Data Scientists to collaborate with visionary plant breeders, breeder analyst, biostatisticians, genomicists, and crop scientists to build digitally enabled science and business capabilities. Join us and use your data science skillset to contribute to our team and help us on our mission!

Title: Data Scientist, Breeder Analyst (MS/PHD)
Job_Description:
Description

Who are we, and what do we do?
Trait Optimization is a multi-disciplinary group within Biotechnology R&D which develops and delivers industry leading solutions for a spectrum of crop research pipeline spanning molecular design to trait performance. We work as collaborative and empowered teams through cross-functional partnerships by adapting novel technologies and analytics.
The Data Scientist will work with a highly talented research team to address critical predictive analytics strategies, leveraging a rich data landscape from diverse crop/plant/trait evaluation platforms.

Title: Data Scientist, Breeder Analyst (MS/PHD)
Job_Description:
Description

Who are we, and what do we do?
At Corteva Agriscience, you will help us grow what’s next. No matter your role, you will be part of a team that is building the future of agriculture – leading breakthroughs in the innovation and application of science and technology that will better the lives of people all over the world and fuel the progress of humankind.
Corteva Agriscience™ has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Scientist with expertise in statistical and machine learning methods. The successful candidate will join a robust, diverse, and globally distributed Data Science team that develops and applies innovative methods and tools to deliver insights for R&D. The candidate will partner with leading industrial scientists to support our growing data science efforts in Crop Protection discovery and Development. The Senior Data Scientist will lead projects applying and researching data science methods, along with providing technical mentorship for junior data scientists. The position will be based in Indianapolis, IN to allow for strong collaboration with laboratory chemists, but remote work needs of highly qualified candidates will be considered.

Title: Data Scientist, Breeder Analyst (MS/PHD)
Job_Description:
Description

Who are we, and what do we do?
Corteva Agriscience™ has a rich history of scientific discovery that has enabled countless innovations. We’re looking for more people, to collaborate with us to create a market-shaping, agriculture company with leading positions in seed technologies, crop protection and digital agriculture.

We need an Environment Systems Data Scientist to collaborate with visionary crop scientists, agronomists, plant breeders, crop protection scientists, engineers, and software developers to build digitally enabled science and business capabilities.
